thread.title: Phila. School District: Policies Will ‘Not Change’ Despite Trump Administration Transgender Bathroom Decision

author: CBS Philly
title: Phila. School District: Policies Will ‘Not Change’ Despite Trump Administration Transgender Bathroom Decision

persons.name: william hite ray boyd follow ray boyd

organizations.name: trump administration transgender bathroom decision phila
obama treated media worse than trump

text:
Phila. School District: Policies Will ‘Not Change’ Despite Trump Administration Transgender Bathroom Decision February 22, 2017 9:03 PM By Ray Boyd Filed Under: Donald Trump , Trump Unisex signs hang outside bathrooms at Toast Paninoteca on May 10, 2016 in Durham, North Carolina. (Photo by Sara D. Davis/Getty Images) 
PHILADELPHIA (CBS) — On Wednesday night, President Donald Trump’s administration announced that they were doing away with policies enacted under President Barack Obama that outline transgender bathroom guidelines in public schools that received federal funds. 
The Obama administration held the stance that discrimination, based on sex, fell under the jurisdiction of Title IX and that that also included gender identity. 
James Rosen: Obama Treated Media Worse Than Trump 
Following the announcement, the Philadelphia School District responded. The district released the following statement regarding the reversal on transgender bathrooms. 
“The School District of Philadelphia remains a safe and welcoming place of inclusion for all our students. Every student deserves to know their rights will be recognized and upheld at school. This announcement will not change any school district policy or city law that protects our students.” 
– Superintendent Dr. William Hite Ray Boyd Follow Ray Boyd is a Digital Content Producer for CBSPhilly.com, covering news, entertainment, sports and all the stories that impact the audience of CBS 3, KYWNewsradio, WIP and WPHT. Boyd started his career with CBS as a pormotions assis...
